info.title: ARM
info.description: Azure Resource Manager exposes the APIs to manage all of your Azure resources.

get.description: Lists the locations available for the subscription.
Reads the details for a particular subscription.
Gets a list of all the subscriptions to which the principal has access.

delete.description: Deletes a resource group template deployment. The resources will not be deleted; only the metadata about the template deployment.

put.summary: Create or update a template deployment
put.description: Create or update a named resource group template deployment. A template and parameters are expected for the request to succeed.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Additional parameters supplied to the operation.

get.description: Reads a template deployment within a resource group.

post.description: Cancel a currently running template deployment. All pending template operations will be suspended.
Validates a deployment template. This operation does not have side effects and can be used to test a template deployment for syntax or logical errors.
Exports a template from a past resource group deployment.

get.description: Lists all the resource group template deployments. This operation is useful to know what has been provisioned thus far.
Reads a particular resource group template deployment operation. This is useful for troubleshooting failed template deployments.
Lists all the template deployment operations. This is useful for troubleshooting failed template deployments.

post.description: Unregisters provider from a subscription. This operation will fail if there are any resources from that resource provider in the subscription.
Registers a resource provider to be used with a subscription. This will provision permissions for the service into your subscription.

get.description: Lists the resource providers available for the subscription.
Reads a particular resource provider within the subscription.
Lists all the resources under a resource group.

put.summary: Create or update a resource group
put.description: Creates or updates a resource group. The response code will indicate if it were a create or update.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group to be created or updated.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to the create or update resource group service operation.

delete.description: Delete a particular resource group within the subscription.

get.description: Reads a particular resource group within the subscription.

patch.description: Updates an existing resource group. If the resource does not exist, this request will fail.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to the update state resource group service operation.

post.description: Exports a deployment template from an existing resource group. This can only be successful if the underlying resources have a schema defined by Microsoft.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to the export template resource group operation.

get.description: Lists all the resource groups within the subscription. Paginates at 1,000 records.
Reads all of the resources under a particular subscription. The results are paginated at 1,000+ records.

put.description: Creates or updates a resource. The response code can be used to distinguish between a create (201) or update (200).

delete.summary: Delete a subscription resource tag value
delete.description: Delete a subscription resource tag value.

put.summary: Create or update a subscription resource tag value
put.description: Create or update a subscription resource tag value.

put.summary: Create or update a subscription resource tag name
put.description: Create or update a subscription resource tag name.

delete.summary: Delete a subscription resource tag name
delete.description: Delete a subscription resource tag name.

get.description: Lists all the subscription resource tags.

id.description: The fully qualified Id of the location. For example, /subscriptions/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000/locations/westus.

displayName.description: The display name of the location.

id.description: The fully qualified Id. For example, /subscriptions/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000.

authorizationSource.description: The authorization source of the request. Valid values are one or more combinations of Legacy, RoleBased, Bypassed, Direct and Management. For example, 'Legacy, RoleBased'.

locationPlacementId.description: The subscription location placement Id. The Id indicates which regions are visible for a subscription. For example, a subscription with a location placement Id of Public_2014-09-01 has access to Azure public regions.

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

TemplateLink.description: Entity representing the reference to the template.

contentVersion.description: If included it must match the ContentVersion in the template.

ParametersLink.description: Entity representing the reference to the deployment paramaters.

contentVersion.description: If included it must match the ContentVersion in the template.

template.description: The template content. It can be a JObject or a well formed JSON string. Use only one of Template or TemplateLink.

parameters.description: Deployment parameters. It can be a JObject or a well formed JSON string. Use only one of Parameters or ParametersLink.

code.description: The error code returned from the server.

message.description: The error message returned from the server.

AliasPathType.description: The type of the paths for alias.

ProviderResourceType.description: Resource type managed by the resource provider.

locations.description: The collection of locations where this resource type can be created in.

aliases.description: The aliases that are supported by this resource type.

registrationState.description: The registration state of the provider.

resourceTypes.description: The collection of provider resource types.

correlationId.description: The correlation ID of the deployment.

timestamp.description: The timestamp of the template deployment.

providers.description: The list of resource providers needed for the deployment.

template.description: The template content. Use only one of Template or TemplateLink.

parameters.description: Deployment parameters. Use only one of Parameters or ParametersLink.

DeploymentValidateResult.description: Information from validate template deployment response.

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.
The URL to get the next set of results.

managedBy.description: Id of the resource that manages this resource.

principalId.description: The principal id of resource identity.

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

id.description: The ID of the resource group (e.g. /subscriptions/XXX/resourceGroups/YYY).

name.description: The Name of the resource group.

location.description: The location of the resource group. It cannot be changed after the resource group has been created. Has to be one of the supported Azure Locations, such as West US, East US, West Europe, East Asia, etc.

managedBy.description: Id of the resource that manages this resource group.

tags.description: The tags attached to the resource group.

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

ExportTemplateRequest.description: Export resource group template request parameters.

resources.description: The ids of the resources. The only supported string currently is '*' (all resources). Future api updates will support exporting specific resources.

options.description: The export template options. Supported values include 'IncludeParameterDefaultValue', 'IncludeComments' or 'IncludeParameterDefaultValue, IncludeComments

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

timestamp.description: The date and time of the operation.

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

SubscriptionIdParameter.name: subscriptionId
SubscriptionIdParameter.description: The unique identifier for the  Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the ID for every Azure resource.

DeploymentNameParameter.name: deploymentName
DeploymentNameParameter.description: The name of the resource group template deployment.

ShortResourceIdParameter.name: shortResourceId
ShortResourceIdParameter.description: The fully qualified Id of the resource, including the resource name and resource type. For example, /subscriptions/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000/resourceGroups/myGroup/Microsoft.Web/sites/mySite

FilterParameter.name: $filter
FilterParameter.description: The filter to apply on the operation.

TopParameter.name: $top
TopParameter.description: Query parameters. If nothing is passed returns all values.
